duck: Author citation (zoology) - In zoological nomenclature, author citation refers to listing the person who first makes a scientific name of a taxon available.
Author - An author is broadly defined as "the person who originated or gave existence to anything" and whose authorship determines responsibility for what was created.

was a prominent American author of the 19th century.]] An 'author' is broadly
 defined as "the person who originated or gave existence to anything" and whose
 authorship determines responsibility for what was created. Narrowly defined, an
 author is the originator of any written work.<ref> [A compilation of the
 bibliographies and short biographies of notable authors up to 1974.]</ref>
